intro: Diplotaxis mandonis, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, dark green leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Diplotaxis mandonis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
